name: Comprehensive System and Cloud Software Suite
description: A feature encompassing tools, software, and resources for system infrastructure, cloud computing, creative tasks, educational environments, legacy compatibility, and advanced input/output processing. This feature provides a unified framework for managing and integrating diverse components such as 3D printing software, backup solutions, text and graphics editing tools, educational applications, compatibility packages, and cloud infrastructure along with server tools, ensuring seamless operation across modern and legacy environments.

name: Comprehensive Linux Functionalities Suite
description: A modular suite of features and tools aimed at enhancing the functionality, usability, and extensibility of the Linux operating system. This parent feature covers a wide range of capabilities including desktop environments, multimedia support, load balancing, storage solutions, authentication mechanisms, and specialized toolkits. Designed for diverse use cases, it supports file sharing, clustered storage, personalized setup configurations, and advanced educational and multimedia needs.

name: Desktop Environments and Related Feature Set
description: This parent feature encompasses a comprehensive collection of desktop environments, window managers, and associated applications designed to provide a range of user experiences, from lightweight environments for low-end machines to elegant, feature-rich interfaces for modern systems. It also includes additional activities and applications tailored for specific environments, ensuring an adaptable and user-friendly experience for different types of hardware and user requirements.

name: Linux Comprehensive Software Stack
description: A unified parent feature encompassing the core functionalities and development environment enhancements required for a wide range of use cases, including base operating system installation, software development, web application deployment, and platform-specific programming support. This feature serves as a holistic representation of vital Linux capabilities and tools, catering to both server and desktop platforms.

name: System Features and Tools Suite
description: A comprehensive collection of features and tools designed to provide diverse functionality for system administration, hardware management, software development, graphical interface customization, audio production, gaming, and entertainment. This parent feature brings together a wide range of specialized tools and environments to cater to users with diverse requirements, ranging from basic system setup to advanced system management and creative workflows.

name: Network and Server Functionality
description: This parent feature encompasses a wide range of network and server-related functionalities, allowing the system to run essential services for communication, data sharing, printing, and hosting. These include acting as a DNS name server, managing email and news services, supporting web and file sharing, enabling remote and network-based printing, providing Java servlet hosting, facilitating connections to network storage, and supporting local or remote graphical display. This feature set is essential for configuring the system as a robust and versatile server or client in various networked environments.

name: Linux System Feature Set
description: A comprehensive feature set encompassing all core functionalities and mandatory packages across various Linux-based products and configurations. This parent feature ensures the inclusion of development tools, ostree support, and essential core components necessary for diverse use cases, including server, client, workstation, and compute node environments. The sub-features provide specialized support for development, atomic host configurations, and tailored needs for distinct Linux product types.

name: Advanced System Management and Development Tools
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and libraries designed for advanced system management, application development, diagnostics, and performance optimization. This feature covers capabilities for software development, container and virtualization management, security auditing, system performance analysis, network administration, scientific computing, and integration with various specialized systems such as mainframes, identity management servers, and dial-up networking. It includes both command-line and GUI-based tools catering to diverse user and infrastructure needs.

name: Linux Virtualization and Management Toolkit
description: A comprehensive feature set encompassing tools, utilities, and interfaces for virtualization, container orchestration, remote management, platform-specific virtualization environments, and packaging utilities. This toolkit supports managing and running virtualized environments, containers, and remote interfaces, catering to multiple technologies such as KVM, Hyper-V, VMware, and Kubernetes (k8s).

name: Critical Path and Essential Software Features
description: This parent feature encompasses a comprehensive set of features and packages critical for system functionality, desktop environments, development tools, and user-specific extensions. It includes the core and auxiliary components required to build, compose, and maintain Linux systems across multiple environments and use-cases, as well as additional software for enhanced user experience.
children: Extra games for the GNOME Desktop
Extra plugins for the Xfce panel

name: Linux Ecosystem Core Features
description: A comprehensive collection of core features and functionalities designed to support application development, database management systems, multimedia handling, graphical interfaces, and scripting support within the Linux operating system. These features encompass development tools, compatibility layers, open-source frameworks, and database server/client solutions essential for building and running modern Linux-based applications in diverse environments.

name: System and Network Infrastructure Services
description: Provides a comprehensive suite of tools, services, and infrastructure to support system development, directory services, domain management, network-based servers, and high availability environments. This feature group encompasses development tools, directory clients and servers, domain membership services, as well as legacy and modern network infrastructure and servers. It is designed for environments needing central identity management, integration into managed networks, and robust infrastructure for both standard and specialized network protocols.

name: Office and Productivity Applications
description: A comprehensive parent feature encompassing a wide range of office and productivity-related software suites and tools. This feature includes desktop-specific office suites such as Deepin Desktop Office, KDE Office, LXDE Office, LXQt Office, and Xfce Office, as well as cross-desktop productivity solutions like LibreOffice. It further emphasizes general-purpose office suites and productivity tools for managing tasks, creating documents, and enhancing efficiency. Additionally, applications related to specific niche purposes, like robotics development tool suites, are considered extensions of productivity capabilities.

name: Custom Linux Installation Packages and Features
description: This parent feature encapsulates a diverse set of package groups and functionalities for Linux-based installations. These sub-features include graphical interfaces, scientific tools, virtualization hosts, database systems, and conflict management for various installation scenarios. The provided features facilitate creating tailored Linux environments ranging from minimal installations to specific use-case setups such as servers, workstations, and compute nodes. Each sub-feature is designed to meet specific requirements for users or administrators creating modular and functional Linux systems.

name: Comprehensive Software Development Toolkit
description: A unified and extensive collection of tools, libraries, and frameworks designed for diverse software development needs, ranging from graphical applications, core libraries, and integrated development environments to platform-specific setups. This feature encapsulates specialized packages required for developing and designing applications across multiple ecosystems, GUIs, and environments such as .NET, GTK+, KDE, X Window System, Xfce, LibreOffice, VMware, and more.

name: Desktop Environment and Application Functionality
description: A comprehensive feature set encompassing desktop environments, commonly used applications, foundational modular components, accessibility, and functionality support for various desktop environments, programming tools, and virtualized systems. This parent feature serves to provide a cohesive structure for desktop usability, application integration, and specialized tools for productivity and teaching.
